user_review: The ambiance is great. Service is great. The food is great. Thoroughly enjoyed the sandwich known as "The Super."Will eat here again... The next time I'm in Montreal!

Reuben's Deli is by far in my opinion the Best best best place for a smoke meat sandwich trusttt me !!!Ps: Now please don't confuse yourself with the other gloomy basement reubens resto ... The reubens store front location is big and spacious and there's no walking down in a basement it's on the main ground floorAmbiance: Largee and welcoming.. the sign's bright and attractive Fancy bright sign just calling my name.Came here yesterday as the last time was years ago! Still is the Best place and I truly believe it's the greatest place (BETTER THAN SHWARTZ's ) hahaha yesss I said it .. i'm a local connoisseur for good Montreal smoke meat and if you want the real deal here it is ! I love the feel of reubens it reminds me of a classic NYC resto feel with the service and feel Service: 5 stars all the way Fancy and well treated always !the staff is super attentive and friendly they truly care and always give me the best service ! As you walk in it was extremely packed and yet they still made sure to treat me like GOLDFood: I had my smoke meat with the cut I asked for and the portions are large and Generous! The fries are delicious jUlienne style yummy 5/5 the smoke meat is smoked in house in the front of the store pretty sweet and just so succulent with flavoursI love the Latkas 5/5++++++ It comes with sour cream and apple sauce pretty nice fresh crispy and just deliciously freshMy husband had their club roll .. it was deelish as I had to have a bite from his sandwich!!!Overall : there's not much I can add that has bot been said about this amazing place other than you must Try it out if you want some real authentic deli food in the city this is The real deal. If you haven't tried reubens yet .. i strongly suggest you do yourself a favour and give this place a visit ! You won't be disappointed!

Came on a weekend shortly before 6pm, the place was popping and we luckily managed to get a table before the wait began to build.Ordered the signature original Reuben sandwich. Delicious piles of sliced smoked meat with melted Swiss cheese in a savory grilled sandwich. I can see why they are known for this sandwich as it was just incredibly filling and tasty.Also, got the original strawberry cheesecake and the wild blue yonder cheesecake to share with my group. The original strawberry cheesecake was alright, the cheesecake section was kinda bland. The wild blue yonder cheesecake was a lot better and a lot more richer. Though, I am biased being from NY and always eating NY style cheesecakes. They were giant portions so I would recommend ordering one to share. Everything here is actually giant portions so I would recommend ordering single dishes and splitting it.

When in Montreal do what the locals like and are know for. With our entourage we decided to try this place that's been a staple of the neighborhood for some time. Parking can be tough as it's usually a challenge in the city. However once inside the place is quite spacious with glass displays of all their delicatessen and meats that they're known for. As for main I ordered their famous Rueben sandwich and boy was it huge, more meat than what the sandwich could hold. Served with pickles and fries this dish was easily a shareable for two. Prices are on the mid-higher end die to the area and popularity, however still worth the experience for those who have never been here.

We came here after some serious shopping at Canada Goose, since it's just down the street. It reminds me of an old school NY deli, they have local celebrities and professional sports players who have signed plates hanging on the wall.We each had a sandwich, I had a turkey melt- it was good. With poutine fries on the side. My partner in crime had a French dip sandwich it was good.  We split the fried pickles to start.... AMAZING. They had big desserts but we were to full and wanted to continue to get our shop on. Service was okay, we were without water and the waiter forgot my Perrier but it was fairly busy. I'd come back for the pickles.

I hope you are hungry!!! These roast beef sandwiches are HUGE and very tasty! Their poutine is also something they are known for so we got that as well. poutine is fries topped with meat and gravy.We were in a food coma after we ate all of this.

In town for the day and needed something to eat. This place definitely filled us up! I ordered the smoked meat salad and it was amazing! Large enough to share with a couple people but absolutely delicious! The presentation was amazing! The only thing that would make it better is additionally smoked meat on top!Overall it was a great experience and I would love to eat there again!

Whenever we are are in Montreal, and that's never enough, we alwaysvisit Rueben's Deli on St. Catherine West. The place is now pretty much a stalwart for the traditional Montreal smoked meat aka Pastrami brisket. On a recent Sunday night the place was pretty crowded and we ordered the 10 oz smoked meat sandwiches on rye.  Naturally you can get largerones, dare I say supersize, but this simply too much food.  Fries, a pickle and you are happy.  Our server was prompt and pleasant and suggested some Canadian Lager on tap.  Good idea.Such meals are filling and there's never room for desert but most patronsseem to order one anyway.Reuben's is consistent and decently priced and always a good pitstop from downtown shopping.  We'll be back!

Stopped here for lunch on a recommendation after our bus tour.   We had the smoked meat sandwich and French onion soup  which was delicious.    Busy place but service and food was great.  Check it out if you are in town.

THE ultimate smoked meat sandwich! IMO it is the best smoked meat sandwich and I'd like to think I've had many in my time (including a few in Montreal). Reubens is located right in downtown Montreal and is on their busiest street St. Catherine's. Big but good menu, service is good and portion is huge... so come with an appetite, portion is good enough to share. If you feeling really meaty... get the smoked meat chopped up on your poutine... so good!!

Great spot for a last minute easy dinner. We walked in on a busy night without any reservations. They were busy but we were seated quickly. The display case has you drooling for dessert before you even sit down. We started with some delicious cocktails and an order of the chop chop poutine. We are from the US so that poutine is a treat for us. Then we each had a sandwich! Woof that's a lot of food (and fries unless you sub for a salad). I couldn't stop thinking about those deserts in the case. Even though we were stuffed we went for the cheesecake. I don't want to say I was disappointed but my expectations were high since I'd been thinking about it since we walked in. I would have liked more sauce / berries. It was a very cheesy cheesecake, not a lot of crust or sweetness. Maybe I'm not familiar with that style, but I prefer a sweeter creamier cheesecake.

My first Montreal smoked meat sandwich in dt Montreal! This place is very convenient if you are far away from Schwartz and don't want wait in the line. Must Try Lunch Item: Reubens original sandwich. It came in large portion, piled with smoked meats and cheese melted on of top, buttered rye breads. This was all topped off with skinny fries, a pickle and coleslaw. The the size of the sandwich came served in halves. It was def shareable with a friend or you could opt to take the second half to go to avoid afternoon food-itis. Due to the large portion, I went totally all out on fingering the sandwich rather than trying to be fancy with the fork/knife. The meat was mmmm yummy and the bread was so moist, deliciously complimented by the salted cheese. The waiters were also super attentive on filling our waters and checking up on us. The atmosphere was def good for business client lunch although it could get a bit loud given all the tourists visiting in the area.
Great Service and Awesome Food!  Nothing else to add!   A Must Stop when your in Montréal! Tr

Went here at around 8pm on a Saturday and had about a 30 minute wait for a table. Extremely busy restaurant but the service is pretty good. Tried the big bang (1lb smoked meat) and it was thick, and the meat was moist. Only minor issue is there is no way the bread can hold the a sandwich with this much meat. The portion of fries with the meal is almost a meal in itself as well. Overall a great experience and would return.

Great choice for late night dinner in downtown Montréal Food:MTL smoked meat sliders - 5/5 - delicious slices of such tender brisket that literally breaks apart in your mouthCajun jambalaya pasta - 5/5 - packs quite a spicy kick, so beware!Grilled chicken penne primavera - 5/5 - good hearty and filling Louisville bourbon steak sandwich - 4.5/5 - you definitely taste the steak; I didn't like it being so chewy, but my father loved it for it's chewy fibersBandera BBQ chicken sandwich - 5/5 - good choice, a big portion with bbq flavor on the level of chick-fil-a Service:Neglectful when busy, but super friendly and attentive once given a chanceAmbience:Dim lit but warm cafe / restaurant / bar setting

Came here as a tourist and was not disappointed! The smoke meat was delicious, it was packed with flavor and so tender. I must say, my friends and I are not big meat-eaters so the poutine and the sandwich together was a little much. I think I had enough meat to last me the week. But i was happy to have tried both famous dishes and enjoyed both very much. The ambience of the restaurant was very nice but it is definitely a popular place and pretty crowded with both locals and tourists. They had some pretty delicious looking desserts and cheesecake that my friends and I had no more space in our stomachs for but will try next time! The service was also great, had a lovely waiter, very welcoming and happy to explain the food to newbies :)

Before we visited Montreal for the first time we asked for suggestions, most people told us to check out Reuben's. When we walked in the place was packed but we were seated fairly quickly, I asked our waiter Murad H. if I could substitute a vegetarian option for some of the dishes (ex. Greek chicken salad without chicken). He was very rude and told us he could put a note on our order but would charge us the same amount for all dishes. When we asked him for some vegetarian options on the menu he was not helpful at all and gave us attitude. A different waiter came and gave us our food I ordered a plain spaghetti with tomato sauce and the person I was with ordered a deli sandwich option. The food was not bad but we were extremely disappointed with the service. Not once did our waiter check on us or stop by our table. I suggest for anyone visiting Montreal to go to a different restaurant for an authentic experience. We left and grabbed drinks at another restaurant down the street which had much better service Update: it's hilarious looking at all the negative reviews for this establishment. They all follow the same line of "are you sure it's this location not one further down the street" I doubt they take these complaints seriously and use it to teach their staff about customer service. Lots of other restaurants in town that you should visit before Rueben's

Recently moved here from the states. One of my favorite places in New York is Katz's deli For the pastrami sandwich. Accidentally found Rubens while walking downtown and I have to say this might be my favorite restaurant ever! The interior is beautiful the smells a wonderful and so are the staff. First smell was breakfast, eggs and a couple pieces of smoked meat. It was very good but in no way prepared me for when we came back for lunch and had the Reuben sandwich! Oh my God! I cannot say enough about the sandwich. Today I had the 10 ounce smoked meat famous sandwich and I am in love with it. I'm not a huge guy but next time we go there which might have to be in the next couple days I am going to have the 1 pound smoked meat sandwich! You live once but you can eat often at Rubens. One of the best eateries I have ever been to!

My colleagues say they would give five stars. But I am giving four stars since I thought their smoke meat was too salty. Overall, Reuben's lived up to their expectations. No more need to say. Go try it your self

The food was good however, the server we had did not acknowledge us at all. We sat down he came over with water and just left. Once he came over to our table to take our order, he didn't even explain that we can choose a different a side with our sandwiches. He just stood there and placed our order. We ordered the short rib poutine, roast beef melt, and a spaghetti. We realized we can replace the fries with something else when we overheard the other servers saying you can replace fries with other sides. The other servers were very accommodating, friendly, and actually acknowledge their customers while our waiter could not have been more indifferent.Also, the food took a decent amount of time to come. I noticed other tables that were there after us were getting their food first. So overall was not a good experience.

This place is amazing! My husband and I follow a Keto lifestyle and wanted to have smoked meat. Get the smoked meat salad! We could have split it! Insane presentation and so yummy! The ingredients were fresh and the salad was nicely dressed. This is literally the best salad I've ever had! The service was great and they had a kids menu! Super generous portions and tasty food! We would definitely come back!

Was in Montreal for the weekend and this was our last meal before I was heading back home. Needless to say, I wanted this to be the best meal, sadly was the worst meal of my trip.This place is a perfect tourist trap and I went here based on some of the reviews on Yelp. I ordered the Rib Tips as my entree and we also ordered the Chop Chop Poutine - both of which were really bad, the poutine being the worst. Their dishes are very high on sodium, especially the poutine which left a terrible, salty after taste in our mouth.One star goes to our wonderful waitress who did a great job. She was extremely warm and welcoming. Food deserves a big fat zero! Will not recommend this place to anyone for food.

I felt like having a smoke meat sandwich during my lunch. There are a few places that serve smoke meat within the downtown core. I was hearing some positive things about the Reuben's Deli & Steakhouse near Peel on Ste-Catherine so I decided to give it a try. I've been to the Reuben's located near McGill College Avenue a few times so I wanted to give this Reuben's a try.I went in and the hostess asked me how many people and I said one. She then asked me if I wanted to sit at the bar or at a table and I mentioned that it didn't really bother me. She walked me over to a table and placed a few menus on the table along with my utensils. Inside, this place appeared nicer than the Reuben's located downstairs near McGill College Avenue.I took a look at one of the menus and noticed that they offered a lunch smoke meat special so I opted to go with that. There was an option to have beer so I picked this option.The server came by my table and asked me whether I wanted to start off with something to drink. I mentioned that I had decided that I would have the lunch smoke meat combo with a beer.She picked up my menus and a few minutes later, she came back with my beer. Not wanting to finish my beer before my lunch arrived, I waited for my smoke meat combo (smoke meat sandwich on rye bread, pickle, coleslaw, and fries) which came a few minutes later.The fries were shoestring type fries and I found them to be a bit on the hard side so it was difficult at times to use my fork to get the fries. The coleslaw was very good and the pickle was good (i.e. neither were too sour or too salty for my taste). The smoke meat sandwich was humongous. In terms of the taste of it, it was good but I found it to be a bit too "wet" and prefer the much drier/flakier smoke meat variety of Smoke Meat Pete and/or Schwartz's.Finished my meal and my beer and was asked if I wanted something else. I looked at my watch and except for asking for a glass of water, I declined since I needed to leave. She asked me if I was going to pay by card or cash. I mentioned I would pay by credit card and she returned with a portable card machine. I paid my bill, finished my water and left.When paying my bill, the server was standing somewhat close and over me which made me somewhat uncomfortable. I'm not sure if she felt that I would steal the portable card machine, damage it, or not leave a tip.In terms of the seating, I should have probably opted to sit at the bar since I was seated right next to where the servers get their utensils (and I believe water) so it was somewhat busy/noisy where I was sitting as multiple servers kept coming back/forth behind me to collect their items. So servers were standing slightly on my back left corner somewhat regularly during my lunch.I rank the experience and food 3.5 stars which I've generously rounded up to 4

I love this place. Located at the heart of downtown, and always busy, they have great service, delicious smoked meat and plenty of other menu options if that's not your kind of food.I actually prefer this smoked meat to any other place I've tried in Montreal. They slice it real thin and it's very tasty and juicy.During my last visit, I ordered the Super Reuben sandwich (I think it's called), served with fries, coleslaw and a pickle. The waitress was excellent and even brought me a sample when I wasn't sure if I'd like it. The portions are huge so either come starving or prepare to take a doggy bag home! I've always enjoyed my food here and I'm already craving their sandwich again!! Will be returning.

We first tried Schwartz's and were craving another smoked meat sandwich, so Reuben's seemed like the next best thing. The sandwich itself was good, but definitely doesn't compare to Schwartz's. The meat here is closer to pastrami while Schwart's is closer to corned beef. The cole slaw that comes with the sandwich is delicious. We ordered plain poutine instead of fries and it was okay, a bit flavorless.For drinks, we the STRAWBERRY CAIPIROSKA. It was delicious and the bartender was really great and friendly. It just doesn't seem like they wash the measuring cups too frequently.

This place is amazing!!! My family and I ordered an array of entrées which included an original Reuben sandwich, poutine and a large house salad. This place gets packed so making reservations to ensure seating is highly recommended.

Let me start off by saying that I really enjoyed my smoked meat reuben here. It was very tasty, there's no denying that. Love that I can get cherry peppers on the side here too. This place feels like a quintessential New York City deli with giant sandwiches and oversized slices of cake! What's not to like?!We told our server how much we enjoyed our meals, and he responded with... telling us how we should really try somewhere else!! He said the meat here isn't smoked in house and that he isn't even sure how it is made, and then told us the places to go if we wanted real smoked meat. Now, I'm not sure what to think about this place. It's obviously carved in house because we could see them slicing it.. I guess that's what they mean by "prepared in house." Kind of disappointing to hear, especially after I was about to walk away so happy!

4 stars for ambiance and service. 3/3.5 for food.  Visited this restaurant based on a recommendation from our hotel. Family-friendly and pretty good food. We had the smoked meat poutine, one of the smoked meat sandwiches, and got some cheesecakes to go. Service was friendly, decor was pleasant. Mostly booth seating. Waited a little bit for a lunch table, but it wasn't too bad. Would return if in the area and I'd recommend!

Late lunch on a Weds so immediate seating. Corner seat was nice!7oz sandwich on brioche was better than 10 oz "famous" sandwich on rye.  The meat was more moist and the bun wasn't dry.  The smoked meat is seasoned just right and has the right amount of fat:meat ratio!  Upgrade your fries to poutine and you obv won't regret it!  Service was fast and friendly!

The absolute best steak I have had in years. The chef was kind enough to drop it to me himself as I was seated at the bar next to the kitchen. Sam's service is informative and engaged, despite his back and forth making the drinks and desserts for the rest of the waitstaff. The wait times have always been reasonable, and while it is a little more expensive than my usual fares, the quality and location make it a reasonable price. All my interactions with their staff from hostess to chef have been positive and memorable, which is rare in this industry where table turnover is often prioritized over treatment of the individual.

This is my favorite diner place around Montreal downtown. Compared to other diners in the area I felt the price here is bit lower while having the same food quality. I tried smoked meat sandwich and it was brilliant. The waiters are friendly and attentive to details. You must try the cheesecake as well. It's one of the best cheesecakes I have had in Montreal. The only downside is it's underground and it feels kinda isolated from outside world

First stop in Montreal when I visited with my family. We got there pretty late but the place was still in full swing. We ordered the chicken club, original reuben sandwich and a salad that is no longer on the menu but served with shrimp. Their chicken club was HUGE. Large pieces of chicken breast on a nicely toasted white bun and triple layered with a nice smattering of tomatoes. We really enjoyed this dish and accepted that the high price was because of the huge portion. The original reubens sandwich was actually better than Schwartz in our opinion! The meat was not as salty and the sauerkraut had just the right amount of acid to balance the flavours. The most disappointing was the salad since although it was piled high, was VERY expensive for the few pieces of shrimp.Overall, we came here because it was close to our hotel but were surprised by the food.

Good but not great.  Portions are huge, but its also a bit pricier than some of the other places that serves the same food.  We called ahead for a party of 10 and we tucked in the corner of the restaurant.  I was happy they were able to accommodate us, as the place was packed with post game fans.Everyone seemed to enjoy their food, but I thought their smoked meats were a bit saltier than their competitor Dunn's.  I actually didn't want to finish my meal because it was so salty.I would recommend this place for the ambiance.  Its a great place if you need a place to hang with friends.  4 generous stars for this visit.

I came here for lunch and got a Reuben sandwich on rye and WOW its delicious. The flavors are fantastic and everything melts in your mouth. The meat is smokey and perfect. They also give you a large amount of fries. Also, although its a little bit pricier than most smoked meat places, the portions are huge. I could easily split a plate between two people or have leftovers. I definitely recommend this spot if you wanna have a great dinner date (although beware - it can get messy!)

Instagram might tell you that Schwartz' is the place to be, but anyone saying that hasn't had a full fat Montreal smoked meat sandwich from Reubens.Reubens is a much more chill, relaxing environment than many of the other smoked meat places. The large layout and upstairs floor means that you and your friends can get a table at almost any time of the day. The resturaunt is a classic Montreal-style restaurant, dimly lit, and unpretentious. The wait staff is always hilarious and attentive, which is all you can ask for.Now for the food. I'm usually more of a fan of Pastrami sandwiches over smoked meat (nothing tops Katz's in New York), but this smoked meat is the best I've ever had. When ordering from Reubens, you can choose the level of fat that you want on the sandwich. Being that this occasion was a Bachelor Party, we got the maximum amount of fat possible. It was borderline absurd, but we'll worth it.In under 20 minutes, we were greeted with plates of packed smoked meat sandwiches, pickles, and poutines. The pefect Montreal combo. Pair that with any of their select French-Canadian beers, and it's nothing short of perfection. The sandwiches were dripping fat, the poutine cheeses curds were loud and squeaky (as they should be!), and the pickles were delicious. Pro tip: mustard is the only condiment that should ever be used on a smoked meat or Pastrami sandwich. Don't be the person to smother it in ketchup and ruin it.After the sandwiches, we somehow had room for dessert. After looking through a selection of cakes, we settled on a mix of chocolate cakes, croissants, and coffees. Everything was great. So great that we went the next two nights in a row!5/5

UPDATE (01/2019): **Read the business manager's reply.** I docked another star because I do not appreciate being second guessed about where I ate. I am 100% sure this is where I ate. The decor is exactly where I was. I can even point out exactly where I sat (when you walk in, on the back left corner there are a set of stairs that lead to the bathroom - I had sat directly in front of the stairs in a booth). In terms of breakfast sandwiches, I looked. My bf and I had even asked our waiter specifically if they had breakfast options and our waiter explicitly said that they do not have a breakfast menu or breakfast sandwich options. So either your waiter was inexperienced (which, didn't sound like he was) or he was too lazy to give us the breakfast menu/point it out to us. I do not appreciate being second guessed. I stand by the rest of my review though._____They have a wide array of sandwiches...but no breakfast sandwiches? But they are open during breakfast hours? I feel like that's a missed business opportunity...But at the same time, their sandwiches are so expensive. I've never seen such expensive sandwiches that actually only tasted okay.... and I think the reason why they are so pricey is that they load up a large plate of fries... but I'd rather have it be cheaper coz whoever finishes all their fries? lol I don't know if I'll ever go back... just wasn't that good tbh. Unless you like a large plate of food and a sandwich so big you gotta move the meat around to fit it in your mouth lol

Rueben's, great place to stop after shopping on Ste Catherines! Almost always packed! Food comes out beautifully plated and fast too! The service is top-notch! NOTE: As it's almost always full, it can get a bit noisy and crowded in here, but it's on St Catherines so that's a given.

****4 out of 5 stars****It was my mom's birthday, rather than going to the usual Chinese restaurant to celebrate, I decided to bring my mom to Reubens instead.  Overall, the food and desserts were very good.  The only thing it lacked was the attentiveness of the service.  There were several occasions I had to ask for refill of water and clearing of the plates, I can give the benefit of the doubt that it was busy, but an acknowledgement would be have been appreciated.  Also, when my mom's birthday cake arrived, the waitress just put it on the table and she left.  It would have been nice if the wait staff sang happy birthday as well.  They lost one star for service.

Loved the smoked meat! Order anything with smoked meat in it and you know it will be amazing.We were here for lunch on boxing day and the place was packed. Even so, we were seated right away. The moment we sat down, we placed an order of the smoked meat poutine and it did not disappoint. The meat was so flavorful and well seasoned. After that, we continued our meal with more smoked meat by getting the famous super sandwiches and sliders. The best part was we were able to turn our side of fries into side of poutine. You can never go wrong with more poutine. The brisket was so tender and marbled with good amount of fat. It had a good pepper flavor without being overwhelming. I could just  eat pounds and pounds of the meat by itself. We also tried the bbq short rib poutine but it was just okay. I was not the biggest fan of the bbq sauce. Wanting to venture out of the smoked meat dishes, I got the prime rib beef sandwich as well. It was a little lackluster. It was bland and dry. Overall, it was a great meal. I highly recommend sticking to what they are well known for, which is the smoked meat!

We were referred to Reuben's by a tour guide who said this was a great place for smoked meat.  Well, it is smoked meat galore! We liked the booth seating and the bottles of wine all around on the walls. We had the famous smoked meat sandwich and a smoked meat salad (not sure if that's the right name...). We ordered a bottle of wine which we didn't finish and our server recorked it and packed it up with our food so we had a nice picnic later in our air bnb. The portions were big enough to feed us twice. It was busy and happening. I would love to go back again.

We actually got this recommendation from our Club Level Host at our hotel to go to Reuben's for lunch today!  We got here right around 12:15 and the hostess greeted us immediately and seated us right away. The interior of this restaurant is awesome with fantastic wood work. Our waitress Kelsey very courteous and took great care of us. Plus she is bilingual which made it very easy to order. Of course I asked which was the better sandwich and Kelsey said the Reuben hands down!  So 3 of us ordered the Reuben sandwich and 1 ordered the French Dip sandwich. I felt the Reuben was the better choice and it is definitely the best Reuben I have ever tasted!  The Reuben was piled high with Corned Beef and it came with Cole Slaw and Fries. This was an incredible lunch and I highly recommend coming to Reuben's when you are in Montréal!  Thanks to Kelsey for steering us in the right direction!  Reuben's is a very strong 5 Stars !!

This place is a bit pricey or than some restaurants in Montreal... But worth every penny!The staff is attentive, courteous and definitely has a sense of humor in accommodating every customers needs.The menu is a little intimidating, in that it features dishes from many different cultures. This is normally a red flag that the restaurant will not be able to do them all well. Much to our delight, both of our very different dishes were memorable.THE DEAL: this restaurant is known for consistently flavorful food and fast service!

I'm a fan of any place that will feed my most gluttonous urges within about 8 minutes of sitting down.The food here is staunchly middle of the road, but as far as that goes, they execute average food flawlessly and consistently, if that makes any sense. You see, Montreal has several breeds of smoked meat. Schwartz's, The Main, and Smoked Meat Pete offer customers the dry, deep red authentic smoked meat that I crave and prefer above all. This is the real deal and it's hard to find. The fact that it cannot be procured in downtown Montreal is a sad statement. After these establishments, everyone else including Reuben's, Dunn's, and Lester's serves a second version I refer to as "wet" smoked meat. (Dunn's used to serve the real deal smoked meat described above but they switched to the generic version about 10 years ago. Yes, I noticed.)  The product may still be hand carved, but this ubiquitous version of meat is characterized by deep steaming, consistently thin pink slices, and a generic salty and peppery taste. There is nothing wrong with this. It will scratch your itch but it's still not the old school smoked meat with subtle flavours that make you feel like you are taking a bite out of St. Lawrence boulevard circa 1955. Snowdon Deli is a satisfying hybrid of the two genres, but that's another review for another day.Anyhow, this Reuben's deli located on St. Catherine has been renovated several times over the years and charges 20-25$ for a smoked meat and fries. Fine, take my money and give me my "drugs". That is kind of the attitude I take when I'm really hungry. Don't get distracted by their huge menu. Get a smoked meat sandwich or a Reuben. Honourable mention goes to their club roll piled high with stuffed chicken, salami, and smoked meat all served grilled on a roll. Order it with a slice of swiss cheese. Fries are slightly above average. Just to blend in with the tourists, I ordered a smoked meat poutine for 13 dollars. What a sad dish. A poutine should be the size of my head with no exceptions. This one was served in a small bowl with microscopic chopped smoked meat. It was alright, but could have used a coarser chop on the smoked meat and a larger portion to share. They ought to walk around the corner to La Belle Province on Peel. They'll show you how to build a poutine that will take a guy down for the count. Come to think of it, most spots in this city serve their poutines in meal sized portions; Especially when charging 13$ for them.My wife got the chicken caesar salad with dressing on the side. Bless her heart. Anyhow, if you are trying to catch a movie or an event at the Bell Centre, this place is fast and predictable. You can depend on Reuben's.
We went here for dinner today. The Montreal smoke meat was amazing. Our service was so nice and made us feel like home. Thank you for the great food and a enjoyable night.
The service was the highlight of the night and the chicken tenders. Smoke meat was a let down and they servie it with stale bread. Breeze smoke meat restaurants out there.

Lunch couldn't have been better. I love Rubens! Very friendly and courteous service and great food. The brisket sliders were delicious, only thing that slightly irked me was that the bottom bun was fairly soaked and mushy from the juices of the brisket. But it tasted incredible and who cares if I used a fork half way through.  Place is big, seating arrangements comfortable and you leave full with their massive plates. A win for sure!

If you're in the downtown core and not trek out to a place like Schwartz's, this is as good as any.  In fact, I've exclusively come here more often than not because it's more accessible, don't have to worry about the line-ups, and the service has always been really good for me.I've brought many groups out here, and we've all been happy campers.

Reuben's is a great spot downtown Montreal if you looking for a late night spot for eating. Guaranteed to be opened. A true family styled Deli tucked in on St.Catherine. This diner will surprise you. I ordered the lasagna that was pretty good and very generous in portion. I didn't really enjoy my bloody Caesar because it was watered down. The waitress was great to give suggestions. Rainy days, after clubbing/shopping/late night movies come here as one of your options.

Perfection doesn't exist but this restaurant gave me life. If you want a delicious steak you are at the right spot. Grill to perfection lill bit pricey but good quality has a $$price. Well situated in downtown montreal on ste-Catherine street. Nice decor clean plates were huge.

We stumbled upon Reuben's while walking from our hotel. We wanted a place that was casual and quick - and this was it!We sat at the bar because it was available and we were famished. The bartender was super friendly and helpful. I ordered the 3 sliders and my husband ordered a giant sandwich. They both had corned beef on them, essentially the same sandwich in a different shape, but both were great. I especially loved the seasoned chips; the fries were good too.My only reason for not giving 5* is because the rolls & the rye bread were not amazing and that was a little disappointing. I don't eat grain, so I don't normally eat the bun/bread anyway. I'm a tough carb critic!Otherwise we will be back!

Walked in around 4pm and didn't have to wait for a table. The server was very friendly, informative and attentive. This place was absolutely delicious. You MUST have the smoked beef brisket wonton appetizer. It was hot, gooey cheese and brisket in a lightly fried wonton with a dipping sauce. I could have ordered three orders of this just for my meal. Also enjoyed the vegetable flatbread. The veggies were so fresh, you could tell it was made to order. I would highly recommend this place. For dessert, we shared the Montreal style strawberry cheesecake. It was a bit thick/heavy for my taste but was still delicious.

My favourite restaurant when I am in the mood to eat a lot lol. The food is good every time. Its perfect when you are downtown shopping and need to eat something. Every time i go, it is always clean and the people are always nice!

We walked into Reuben's and had a blast of recognition. It seemed so much like Junior's from Brooklyn, with poutine. It's not as old or worn, but as delis go, Reuben's solid. I had smoke meat (pastrami) sliders, my companions had the poutine, all were exactly the right level of artery-clogging goodness. Recommended for a good sandwich or a nice mashup of Jewish deli and Québécois food.

We had the Reuben and the Classic sandwiches. The meat was good on both, but I'm not a fan of the way the sandwich is put together--meat and toppings are piled high in the very center of the bread and then the sandwich is sliced. This makes for a sandwich with shifted toppings on half the bread. Why??? Just to make it look piled high. The toppings also seemed sloppily prepared. I've had a better Reuben elsewhere. Service was decent, though the food took a while to come out.

The smoked meat here is better than Schwartz'. I fully expect a lightning bolt to strike me down for saying this but it's true. The smoked meat poutine needs to seriously work on its fries. They were like flaccid Macdonald's fries. It's not that hard to do. Otherwise I would give this place five stars. Another tip, if you order the Famous Super sandwich you can upgrade the fries to poutine. This was enough for two of us to get a fix and not have to walk around hating ourselves all day.

I came here for dinner with friends on a Tuesday and ordered the smoked meat sliders, cheddar and beer dip, Big Bang sandwich (1 lb smoked meat in rye bread with fries), and strawberry cheesecake. The smoked meat here is amazing: melt-in-your-mouth tender, salty and flavourful, sort of fatty. The fries are thin and light, very tasty. They have a wide variety of cheesecakes (and other desserts too, but mostly cheesecakes) - choose the Montreal-style strawberry cheesecake. It's so tall, the strawberries on top are fresh and plump, and it's very smooth and creamy! Portions are huge and price is reasonable. Service is friendly, but a little too prompt (waitress tried clearing our plates before we were done TWICE). Nice atmosphere on a busy boulevard next to H&M. I will definitely be back!

This was our first smoke meats place that we went to when we first came to Montreal and is still one of our favorites. There are two locations on St. Cats, but we've only been to this one which is somewhere between fancy steakhouse and casual diner. The other one seems more like a take out joint but I'm just guessing. The staff here is fantastic and very helpful, going above and beyond their duties.  The first time we were here we had a double stroller and I felt bad about taking up so much space but the staff was so nice and found a perfect spot for it without batting an eye. Made us feel very welcomed and was really sweet with the kids. Another time, one of our waiters was kind enough to recommend where locals buy household goods and appliances while we were staying in town.  Really appreciate people who love their job. It really shines through. Ok let's talk about food!  The pastrami sandwich is a must. They have a special with their house beer which is fantastic. I can't remember whether it's just a lunch special or all day but the sandwich/beer combo is stellar. I believe the beer was crafted specifically for them so definitely ask about that beer.

Walked by this place several times, and my boyfriend and I decided to give it a shot on our last morning in Montreal. The place was clean and big. Everyone was super friendly. Our server was very nice and quick - within 3 minutes of us being seated, we had already gotten our drinks and food order out.The wait on the food was a little bit long, but the place was busy so I'm guessing that was why.  Our food came and was presented well on the plate.  My boyfriend was a little bit annoyed because he was hungry, and as I said the wait was a little long; when he had tried our fries, they were no longer hot, they had for sure been sitting for awhile.Food was still good, I obviously couldn't finish the entire thing because the portions were huge! Absolutely nothing wrong with that, I saved my other half to bring back to Toronto.  Even eating the sandwich the next day, it was still good.I'll be trying this place again when we do come back, there were some other items on the menu that caught my eye.

Massive portions here at reubens. The "Super"  smoke meat sandwich is 10oz of smoke meat. I had the bread toasted with a slice of Swiss. Just excellent. The meat is sliced super thin and is more tender than Schwartz. Flavor wise it's more salty so it's better you eat it with something than just plain meat. Different experience but definitely still good. Sandwich also comes with fries and slaw. I prefer the slaw here as it's not too watery compared to Schwartz. Wait was a tad long for the food to arrive considering it's just a sandwich.

Quick stop for lunch, Reuben's caught our eye. My girlfriend got the Chicken soup and I got the French Onion. I would have given this restaurant 5 stars if the French Onion soup wasn't so dam salty. I tried to water it down with my glass of water but that didn't work. I just ate the cheese on top. The waiter didn't even care to ask why I didn't even put a dent on it but it's okay. For lunch I got the turkey club with fries. My girlfriend got the Soulvaki Platter. Everything was good, not amazing out of this world good but pretty good. I'd consider going back and ordering a Reuben. I read they are really good here. Big Portions. Good Prices . Good Service. Eh ‍

Ordered the Reuben and original '76. It was delicious. The Reuben has thinly sliced meat and original '76 is soften thicker meat. I liked the thicker one. So soft.Portion is good. Large . Montreal smoked meat!! So yummy

Reuben's has the best pastrami I have ever eaten in my life!!! This was the first restaurant that I stepped foot in during my trip to Montreal. It was then that I fell in love with the city. The menu has quite a variety of items. I had to try the poutine so I ordered the BBQ pulled pork poutine. The crispy fries with the delicious gravy and cheese slathered on top with the juicy pulled pork and BBQ sauce, it was amazing. I ordered the original 76 sandwich which is served with Swiss cheese and mustard on a brioche bun. The pastrami was super juicy and it wasn't too salty. It was perfect with the bun! This sandwich came with fries, coleslaw and a pickle. The coleslaw was a little bland and the veggies were too chopped up. Service was wonderful. All the staff were super friendly and patient. I highly recommend this place!!!
Great sandwiches.. does not disappoint! Large portions and fast service.I got the Rueben at Reuben's deli.. fitting.. secret sauce does not disappoint.Save room for dessert!

Delicious smoked meat.  Terrible rude server:We entered Reuben's Deli on St. Catherine Street around 8 p.m. and informed the hostess we were a table of 11.  We only had to wait a few minutes to be seated.When our server arrived with a tray full of ice waters, I told him that we won't be needing that as our table would like hot waters instead.  Two of my cousins did go for the cold waters he had on his tray which made me look like I was trying to troll the server....I already knew what I wanted to order -- the smoked meat sandwich of course!  Thus, my mom and I shared the Famous Super Sandwich (their 10 oz sandwich) with an extra Baby House Salad as a side.After everyone at the table had decided on what to order, the server came by.  We had previously decided amongst ourselves that we would be paying individually and thus I told the server, "We will be paying individually, so we'd like to request separate bills please."  The server replied something along the lines of, "Sure but you haven't ordered yet."  I replied, "Well, I just wanted to let you know before we placed our orders."  ....  Uh, I was informing him that before we placed our orders because oftentimes, servers prefer that the request for separate bills be announced prior to ordering.  My intention was simply to make our request clear at the outset instead of announcing it at the end.  I didn't like this server's smartass remark already.Anyway, we placed our orders and at the very end when everyone was finished, it was established that each family would pay for themselves.  My cousin confirmed this with the server.  Although the server wasn't speaking to me at this point, I overheard the server saying to them, "It's a little confusing when one person says for the table to want separate bills and then another wants the bills to be paid per family."  I heard this and felt it really wasn't necessary to voice that part again.  A more professional server would say, "So to be clear, not individual bills anymore but separate bills per family; right?" instead of the backhanded comment he said.  Rude.Anyway, it did take some time for the food to arrive.  This wasn't a problem to me because we had the whole night to ourselves and weren't rushed but for some of my family members who were hungry and not used to waiting for all the dishes to come at once (which is the habit at western restaurants compared to Chinese ones), they were getting frustrated with the long wait.Fortunately there was free wifi to tide us over with while we waited.  The food in actuality took around 20 minutes to arrive.The Famous Super Sandwich came with fries, coleslaw, and a pickle.  It was a 10 oz sandwich "piled high" and served on rye bread with mustard. I was so excited to get my hands on it and dig it!  The smoked meat was actually quite good.  It was tender and moist.  The rye bread was a bit soft with the mustard on it.  I ate it quickly to avoid the moist rye bread from falling apart.  I liked how big of a portion the meat was! I'm glad we shared this between the two of us since I definitely wouldn't have been able to finish one whole sandwich by myself.  (Glad that the sandwich was already split in half.)The portion of fries was soooo impressively large.  They were skinny fries.  The coleslaw was so good and was like comfort food to me after eating the smoked meat sandwich.The Baby House Salad was fresh and a good portion of greens for us in conjunction with the smoked meat sandwich.My relatives seemed to enjoy the smoked meat sandwiches they ordered too.  It was their first time eating Montreal smoked meat.  My aunt who ordered the pasta though thought the pasta was too al dente for her taste.When it came to paying the bill, I'm not sure why the server had to again emphasize the fact that '"one person" had mentioned individual billing at first and it turned out not to be'... it wasn't necessary to voice that again. ... a-hole server.All in all, I'm very glad we were able to try this restaurant.  I can finally compare it to Schwartz's smoked meat!  However, although the food was good, the service here from the male server that night was downright rude and spoke unnecessary backhanded unprofessional comments directed at me. :/  It definitely made for a mixed first impression of Reuben's Deli.

I came here craving for some poutine, but because La Banquise was pretty far away, I took my chance on this.And you can tell the difference. Definitely not the same. Not the worst..but definitely not the best either.I also ordered pie and ice cream, just so I can leave here happy. And I was.I did have a good time sitting behind the counter talking with the random people there.
Over priced. Quality isn't the best, certainly not the worst to be fair .Bagel and lox had very little lox , but the lox was delicious. They have booths. We won't be back.

Got here past midnight and this place still had quite a few people inside.I got their super sandwich that came with fries, coleslaw, and pickles (they should probably clarify that in their menu since the 'Smoked Meat' was the only section on the menu that didn't say that :P).The meat was very tender and tasty. I have tried Schwartz and Main a couple years back but I'll have to try it again to compare. I would definitely come back here to try their meat again!And their meat poutine was pretty good too. I really liked the thickness of the fries. It was relatively thin so the fries were crispy, but not too thin.However, I wasn't the biggest fan of their coleslaw and rye bread. The coleslaw had too much water/juice at the bottom so I had to drain it before eating. And the rye bread felt pretty chewy.

Came here at 10 pm after a long day. We were promptly seated in a booth. The service was very fast and the food came out very quickly. I ordered the traditional smoked meat sandwich which came with a lot of (yummy) fries, coleslaw and a pickle. My friend ordered the prime roast beef sandwich. Both were absolutely amazing, and even though we were tourist, they totally lived up to expectations. Would def recommend for a taste of Montreal smoked meat, or any kind of meat in general.

5 Stars! I don't even know if I have to elaborate BUT out of our 4 days there, we went twice and we were staying 30 minutes away! Everything we had was great. Didn't get a picture of the carrot cake cheesecake but it was phenomenal!

Absolutely amazing smoked meat. So tender!!! I might say it's even better than Katz in NYC? Very generous portion too.but the best part? My husband says this place has the friendliest restaurant staff he has ever met! Despite being busy, they were extremely friendly, accommodating, and helpful when he went there to get takeout. Gonna get take out again to have on the way back home to nyc!!!

Can't visit montreal and not get yourself some smoked meat! I went with the classic. So. much. meat. Perfect for your gains and wonderful ratio of meat-to-bread for your low carb diet... Extremely tasty. The fries are a good compliment-- thinly sliced and crispy. I tried a bite of my aunt's liver sandwich; not something you can get just anywhere. I enjoyed it but no where nearly as much as my order.

I split a one pound Montreal smoked sandwich with my wife and was still able to have left overs, served with fries and coleslaw in vinegar.  Meat was delicious, juicy and mouth watering.  Restaurant was busy, friendly staff and had a warm decor.
Just perfectI ate turkey sandwich was delicious. Chocolate cake was killer... Service was excellent and fast but without rush.

We always order the smoke meat and change the fries to a poutine. Portions are always huge and always leave here super full. It's rare that we order dessert since we are full, but when we do have a chance too, we get the cheese cake or the oreo. The food is always good.
I usually stray away from roast beef because it's almost always very dry but I can say that Reuben's made a very good roast beef sandwich and really packed it with lots of meat.

We was staying right across the street when we were in Montreal, so it was only natural we came here the morning after a eventful night of drinking!The place is pretty huge and accommodate a big group.  Our waiter was awesome and did a great job at entertaining us while serving us.  He made us feel welcomed, not like some places in Montreal..We had got a whole bunch of food, the most memorable is the Ruben sandwich and the smoked meat poutine, it was great as hangover food!Would suggest coming here for big groups!
very good service! I enjoyed their grilled salmon salad with their mango daiquiri​!! Yum

I've heard about smoked meat as a popular Montreal food and just so happen to walk past this location around dinner time.I ordered the Famous Super Sandwich and a side of poutine. You can choose the amount of fat you want on the meat in your sandwich and I chose medium. Being my first night in Montreal, the poutine hit the spot and was really good. The size of the sandwich shocked me at first, but I was ready to tackle it. The meat was so soft and not tough at all. It was smoked really well. It was nice that they gave me a bottle of mustard on the side because it definitely needed a bit more mustard. The bread also wasn't anything too impressive to me; just al-rye-t (lol).It was a Sunday night and I was able to get a table spot (I was by myself) even though they initially just offered me a spot at the bar. The servers were really nice, helpful, and attentive to me. However, I did spot a couple tables that had some people waiting a bit more than me (and even longer than usual) just for their order to get taken. Overall, would recommend Reuben's especially if you're visiting Montreal and want to try smoked meat!

On a cold Montreal night we walked into this place that was buzzing with great atmosphere. We waited 10min before we could get a table, as we hadn't made a reservation. We really got lucky with our waiter, Kevin, who was a cheerful, attentive, and funny guy. The drinks came on time. And so did the starters & main course. A definite must try specially if you want great smoked Montreal meat. Server/ Host knowledge: 5Server/host attitude: 5Fast service: 4.5Food Menu: 5Drinks Menu: 5Food quality: 4.5Food Portion: 5Ambience: 4.5Distance to other tables: 4.5Cleanliness: 4.5Comfort: 4.5Waiting time to get seated: 4Price: 4
Nice food, good atmosphere, polite staff, in the crowded and lively Street of Saint Catherine. With a beautiful view of the street and ships

We arrived around 5:15 so it wasn't busy, although it was steady around 6:30. The waiter was very friendly and attentive, and brought us slices of beef brisket to try. This made ordering very easy since we loved it. We got the Famous Super Sandwich and the Original Reuben Sandwich. Both were excellent. The Famous comes with a little mustard on it so you can really taste the smoked flavor of the beef. I only wish the rye bread was better. Crust was very soft and not much rye flavor. Maybe something closer to a Jewish rye would be better. The Reuben was on nicely grilled pumpernickel. For sides, we substituted poutine and cole slaw. The cole slaw is a finely chopped vinegar style and goes well with the meat. Poutine has nice curds, but the fries held up only ok with the gravy. I would have given this 5 stars if they had more beer on tap. Pretty much just 6 basic / mellow beers. Sadly, they had run out of the Hops & Bolt I.P.L. Save room for the very tall slice of cheesecake.

I love Reuben's. Whenever I am in Montreal, I stop by and have a bite to eat. There are two Reuben locations on the same street. I completely bypassed the closest of the two and went to this one, which is the one that I frequent most often. I held the door open for an older gentleman, who appreciated the gesture. He was a regular, as he was promptly seated. I was seated quickly, too. I just visit every year or less. I ordered the beef dip on a French baguette. So flavourful and delicious. Good bread + au jus + tender beef = perfection!Naturally, I ordered a Diet Coke to wash everything down. For someone who doesn't love fries, these were good. A woman at the booth next to mine complained that she didn't want a mountain of fries. I agree with her, but she downright said it in a harsh, loud manner. She then stomped out of the eatery. Of course, I was stuffed, but still managed to order the bread pudding with ice cream. It was decadent and yummy. One of the servers actually turned her head at what she saw before me and asked whether I liked it. She has yet to try it. If you want to be in dessert coma heaven, this dessert is calling out your name. The washrooms are on the second floor. It's definitely an older building. I stood up from my stall and could see everything in front of me, including the door leading me out!(198)

I had a very bad experience at this restaurant.Although it was not my first time there and the food is good I was served by a rude an unprofessional waiter  named  Kevin. I really did not appreciate being the butt of his jokes 3 times during the evening. These were very insulting jokes and I was in shock to hear something like that . I was very disappointed this visit  and won't go back.

Updated review based on managers response to original post.  I thought about it and reconsidered my experience and My overall impression of the experience is still okay.  It wasn't bad but wasn't great.  If I could give half stars I would have given 3.5 but I did not feel the experience was a 4 or better.  In my original review I should have said the poutine with the rib meat was good but I was disappointed in taste and flavor of the smoked meat sandwich. There was nothing wrong as far as a problem with the sandwich to warrant sending it back or notifying the server as suggested by the manager in the response, i just didn't think it tasted good.

This was our last stop before leaving Montreal and it was disappointing! We got the mac & cheese, original sandwich and a burger. The noodles in the mac & cheese were almost as if they were from a box and they just put smoked meat on it. I was really not a huge fan of the mac & cheese. The original sandwich was just okay. It was nothing special. I may have been spoiled from having the smoked meat sandwich from Schwartz the day before, but I was not impressed. The burger was my favorite of all! I loved the bread that it came in and it was a good sized burger.Overall, I really was not impressed. For the price, I really expected more out of the place. I definitely would not recommend you go to the place for a smoked meat experience. There are many different deli's such as Schwartz near the area for a much cheaper price and better quality. I'm providing the three stars for service, the burger and the ambiance of the place.**UPDATE** Per the comment from the business owner, the review I posted is associated with the correct establishment.

This place is named after the person who invented the Reuben sandwich.Technically, the founder worked over at Schwartz's where the lines are long.But there are many fine smoked beef establishments in Montreal including this one. Eating in any of the top twenty will get you something decent.At smoked beef places, do your ordering with care, even if everything is going to be good.What is the issue?This more than any restaurant I know is a "combo" restaurant rather than a pure ingredient restaurant.Normally, I am a straight ingredient kind of a guy.I like straight steak, straight pastrami, straight whiskey, no ice, no mixers.That is NOT how Reuben's is designed and for good reason.One of the differences between a Montreal smoked beef and an American/Irish corned beef - is that Montreal beef is dry cooked rather than boiled.This means that more of the brining chemicals stay in Montreal smoked beef than you get with the American/Irish corned beefNothing boils out into water.This gives Montreal deli an excellent taste but a very strong taste.A Reuben sandwich is a distinct local solution to the highly flavored meat.By combining smoked meat with sauerkraut, swiss cheese and bread, you give some complementary flavors to balance out the brine. WITH the trimmings, the sandwich is perfectly balanced and a delight.Without the trimmings, it is a stronger raw-er commitment.Related principles apply to their chopped liver.They do an excellent chopped liver.But since the restaurant thinks in combos -they combine the chopped liver with WONDERFUL WONDERFUL caramelized fried onions.Both ingredients are good by themselves.But the whole is greater than the sum of the parts -and a mouthful of BOTH onions and liver is definitely better than a mouthful of onions followed by a mouthful of liver.So dilute things down, mix and match and build those combos.Reuben's is a place where flavors work in teams.

We were looking for a place for lunch in an unfamiliar area and looked for a place that was busy. Even though it was busy they sat us right away. The staff was nice and hustled from table to table. The food was good, the french fries best thing on my plate, perfectly cooked shoestring potatoes. The meat was good also, you will not leave hungry, the pickle had passed its prime, the coleslaw was a bit acidosis for my taste.

This place just rocks.  We've visited Montreal many times and while this city is loaded with many many great restaurants, Reubens is a gem.  What makes them special you ask?  ...well it's the execution across the board among many food types.  Feeling like a little Italian?.. no worries their spaghetti bolognese rivals many cities little Italy restaurants.  Sauce is super flavorful with a touch of smokiness from the meat.  If you are a traditional "deli-it's"...the smoked meat deli sandwiches are piled, Er up to a pound of meat!  If you can get past the meat sweats try one of their monster cake desserts.   Oh by the way, we are moving Montreal strictly because of the food and Reubens is one of the reasons why...so load up and enjoy!

Food was phenomenal, and this is coming from a New Yorker! Have to say, it was pricey, portions were not that big, but was actually good. For two adults and two children our bill came to approximately $120 not including tip.

The "chop-chop" poutine was pretty good. Maybe a little too much meat and not enough cheese if any complain about it. Flavor was great though.  My wife had the Reuben and it was very good, the sauce was a bit different than a regular Russian dressing-almost more mustard than Russian, but a nice quality of corned beef and a good quantity as well. I had the "Adams crunch burger" The burger was great. Fried bread and butter pickles, claw and chips right on the burger were awesome. Fries were good (shoe string) but menu didn't say both out meals came with them so we had entirely too much food. Overall 4/5.

This place is convenient location near downtown core on St Catherine's street and very good service and great food. The tradition Reubens classic is the Montreal smoked meat with nice crispy fries and coleslaw and a pickle. Slaw is nice mix of sweet and tart and very complimentary to the smoke meat. They asked if you want it lean or fatty(I take fatty to bring on all the flavour) and it didn't disappoint!Need to come back and try some of the other items on the menu.

What a meal! This very well could be because we spent the day going to and returning from Quebec City on a 3 hour train ride, but this was possibly one of the best meals of my life. They give you so much food! We ordered to-go because we wanted to get back to the hotel before the pool closed, and the service was fast (only about 15 minutes). The staff was pleasant and the host in front was handling everything. She did a fantastic job managing our order, everyone coming in, seating them, and even answering the phone. Finally a manager came to help but she was doing EVERYTHING. The food was fantastic. My wife got one of the burgers and I got a Reuben's sandwich. So so so good. The fries were plentiful and deliciously thin, just the way I like them. We also order some baked macaroni and cheese to start, which was the highlight of the meal. It had bacon on top, and the cheese wasn't super cheesy as it was sweet to offset the saltiness of the bacon. WOW. It was so good we went back the next morning and ordered it again. This isn't a restaurant you need to travel out of your way to go to, but if you are in the downtown area it's a definite lock-in for some dinner time eats. It was fairly priced and I thought I got a lot of food for what I paid. We will definitely be heading back next time we are in Montreal!

Very good sandwiches! My husband and i got the Rueben sandwiches and poutine on the side, both were incredible. The sandwich was the perfect amount of sauce and sauerkraut, a little heavy on the delicious meat but no complaints. Poutine was also well done with gravy and enough curds for every bite. Prices are a bit higher but we got so much food it is worth it !

I guess it's a good smoked meat place.The smoked meat in itself was really good. No doubt.Food wise: The meat is 10/10 but, all our plates came with blend, cold, unseasoned frozen fries. And 1/4 cup of store bought coleslaw. So really you have half of your plate that is really good, then the other half is school cafeteria bad.Btw, I had the chopped liver sandwich and it was good. I would had more mustard and would have traded the fries for extra filling. Then there where a list of other things that made me tick:The washroom is not really great (like the doors are so low you can almost see over it) and located on the second floor.The menu is way to big. They should halve the menu at least.We arrived all having smoked meat sandwiches in our head and then second guess while looking through the seemingly endless possibilities. Then all decided to stick with the original plan. So from the restaurant perspective, we wasted a good 15 minutes scouting for nothing.One thing I will give to this place is thd service was really great, fast and courteous.

Reuben's may be called a deli but it's nothing like a hole in the wall deli that you get your cold sandwich!  It reminds me of a club because of their booths, Art Deco fixtures and paneled walls. We dropped in here for lunch and it was just fantastic!  Dh had the smoked meat sandwich and he said it was the best ever. The kids liked the pulled bbq pork sandwich and smoked meat Mac n cheese. I had a chicken Caesar salad and potato pancakes. The pancakes were the best I've ever had. It was super yummy but a bit greasy. We finished the meal by sharing a chocolate cake. That was the best cake ever!  The cake was super moist and yummy.Service was brisk and efficient. We loved our server Marc Andre. He was very nice.

This Jewish deli basically specializes in smoked meat and steaks. It is busy but the wait staff was very efficient. Was able to get a table without a reservation. I got the Builders Platter, which is a pound of sliced smoked meat with sides of rye bread, cole slaw and fries (I got a double portion of cole slaw instead of fried). The smoked meat was ultra-tender. I prefer the American corned beef with a bit more texture. This was almost mushy in comparison. The cole slaw was a vinegary (rather than creamy) style, and extremely finely chopped. It was good. Overall a decent meal (with a glass of decent red wine) but nothing to rave about. Certainly, not my favorite of the trip and not fine dining.

The French onion soup is really good. The classic Ruben sandwich has a lot of yummy pastrami and the secret sauce is really good. Make sure to ask to substitute your regular fries with chop-chop poutine. The chocolate cheesecake is delicious!
I really like the smoked meat. The service was super fast but still friendly.The mac and cheese was excellent. Our waiter was very kind.

Placed an order for take out. The staff was very nice and helpful. The meal was ready fast. There was more than enough condiments. The desert was also very good. The restaurant was clean and staff was organized.

I was expecting far better but for getting in and seated right away when it was so busy to being served right away I'll give them that.   Unfortunately our waitress wasn't overly happy, she seemed rather rushed and stressed.  The food quality was very large.  Good thing my boyfriend and I shared the Montreal smoked meat sandwich and an order of poutine with smoked meat.  The food was about a 3/5.  Not sure if the sandwich bread is to be soggy but it was.  Meat was tasty.   Poutine lacked flavour; I was expecting a much better meatier tasting gravy.   The coleslaw was very good.   Overall I was hoping for a better experience.   Maybe next time will be better.

So so so basic...  if you're not an adventurous eater and you want extremely commercialized quality of food just go here.  My mom and I came here and got the lunch menu.  She ordered a classic smoked meat sandwich and I got a bbq chicken flatbread.  Both were tasty and HUGE portions for lunch.  The service was great but we were stuffed into a corner booth for two where there was so little space we didn't know where to put our feet.  The whole experience just felt basic.  Although it is extremely popular and well recognized, I would much rather go to a dive restaurant where I know I will be getting something unique.

There really is something for everyone on the menu at Reuben's. Now, yes, this place is kinda touristy in that it's in the heart of downtown where all the tourists are. However, I didn't feel like it's a tourist trap. Like it didn't feel like those places where the food is subpar but you "go for the experience". It felt like this place is probably well know for being a little touristy but you get somewhat of a local experience.Food- Make sure you try the smoked meat. They really have some of the best smoked meat I tasted while in Toronto. It was so moist and fatty that it melted in my mouth. If our luggage wasn't already packed I probably would have grabbed a few pounds to take home. Service- From the moment we walked in we were helped in some way. Our server went on break during our breakfast, but we were definitely not neglected. The replacement server was attentive and even chatted with us for a few minutes. He gave us some local insight on attractions to check out and which ones to skip. Unfortunately, we were grabbing breakfast on our way to the airport so we weren't able to check anything out. But, he definitely gave us a reason to come back to Montreal to check out the Jazz Festival and the Grand Prix.Final note, yes, it feels touristy, but you should do it.

Our mistake was coming here too early. We got there while they were still serving breakfast so my drool dreams of a big hunky sandwich was dashed (totally my fault). We ended up getting breakfast and i made sure to get something that came with smoked meat. It was my first time trying it and it was different. I'm not sure i would try it again or maybe it needed to be on a sandwich.

Without a doubt, the BEST poutine place in Montreal. Their BBQ Short Rib Poutine is to die for. Delicious home-made gravy, perfect McDonald's-style fries, squeaky clean cheese curds, and the most flavourful BBQ short ribs. Absolutely incredible. I initially came here to try their smoked meat to see if it rivals the legendary Schwartz (it does!) but came away raving about the poutine. I even came back here again a second time in one weekend trip to eat the poutine again. The burgers and other fare are fairly good as well but do yourself a favour and go for the poutine. Also got the chance to meet Ron, the ?manager/owner and we struck up a great conversation. Super nice guy even offered me and my girlfriend cheesecake to take with us for free when we left.

Love coming here every Time we're  in Montreal. Superb service situated along St. Catherine's so when your done eating go SHOPPINGWalk up and down checking out all the little overpriced shops and try to find a Quebecois who is willing to speak to you in English. Then work off the calories from that massive slice of cheesecake by window shopping up and down the Avenue.Reuben's never disappoints, but I've noticed  sandwiches are smaller and prices are much higher. Also parking is always a problem, and the Quebecois are horrid drivers.

We enjoyed the delicious food and topnotch customer service so much we had to come back during our 6-day visit to Montreal. The first visit I had the smoked beef brisket chopped salad and my friend had the smokehouse pizza. The salad with the fried onion rings was very tasty. The food portions were generous.We went back a second time and both had salads: the Jimmy the Greek salad and the Grilled Salmon salad. The salads were delicious and plentiful. We ordered the scrumptious carrot cake to carryout. Before our server Paul arrived, Tanya was there to take our drink orders and follow up with us to see if we needed anything else. We appreciate the team effort in providing excellent customer service. Kudos to the manager and staff for making our visit a memorable and pleasant experience.  I'll be sure to visit Reuben's the next time I'm in Montreal.

Both locals and friends who have visited Montreal all reccomended we try their smoked meat while in town. Now where to go? The concierge at our hotel suggested Reuben's. This specific location offers a large restaurant dining, where the other is more like a deli with booths. Worth walking the extra 1/4 mile. The service was so fast! Our drinks, taking our food order and food being served in under 30 minutes. Our server was so nice and patient, answering many questions about the Poutine, famous brisket and more. The food was outstanding. I swear it was the best sandwich I have ever had.  Perfectly toasted bread with melt in your mouth BBQ. My husband felt the same about his Famous sandwich.

My second favourite place for roast beef in Montreal after Schwartz. Location is right in the thick of things; the shopping Mecca of Montreal, St. Catherine Street. They have convenient travel vaccum sealed packaging for out of towners to take this Montreal speciality home. All one has to do is to put that package in boiling water.
Good food, Great Carrot Cake!  I'd definitely go back, so many other cakes to try.

Had the pleasure of visiting Reuben's for a late night snack turned full meal. We enjoyed Reuben's famous short rib poutine along with a thin bruschetta pizza. The portions were generous and the taste of the poutine lived up to the hype. The Long Island iced tea capped off a night enjoying the sights and sounds of Saint Catherine street. The deserts truly were a highlight - possibly even more so than the poutine. We enjoyed strawberry cheese cake and apple crumble and didn't take any back to the hotel. Just too good not to finish. Our server was phenomenal. She gave us lots of insider tips on different cool places to visit during our stay.

Reuben's has become, over the years, one of my favorite breakfast stops in Montreal for a St. Viature bagel, creme cheese, lox, red onion, cucumber, tomato and capers. Something about the bagel and especially the lox, we don't seemed to have the same salmon quality here in the states. I have had lunch  and dinner there as well, the service is always good as is the food quality; the prices are very reasonable. I don't believe you can good wrong stopping in for a nosh when visiting Montreal.

The smoke meat ain't that bad here. Ya can't compare it to Katz deli - it wouldn't be fair - it's different. Tell ya what though, I wouldn't want to wait in line like the rest of the other chumps at the other place. Chumpssssss.....

Very crowded restaurant with mediocre service and food. I had a BLTA (bacon, lettuce tomato and avocado) sandwich on sourdough bread. It was just ok and not memorable! The restaurant packs a great crowd so maybe other options on the menu are more tastier and popular. The menu has so many beef/smoked meat choices that it was difficult to make a decision.

This restaurant is sort of an American oasis in Montreal. It is half old school deli and half steakhouse. It's located downtown so right off if you are planning to visit, plan to pay for parking or catch the metro. This place is busy. When we walked in we were greeted by great old school music, giant cakes sitting in a display case and waiters in long white aprons. We were here for dinner and were seated right away. We order smoked meat sliders, tuna melt, bourbon glazed filet and soft drinks. The shocker, they don't give refills on soft drinks. Tip: Ask for no ice so you get more to drink. The food was delicious. They lived up to the hype. What I do not feel is that we ate 189 Canadian dollars worth of food. Because this is downtown and in a tourist area you should be prepared to pay more. This is a great special occasion place to eat. Try the smoke meat sandwich. It's really worth the try.

Reubens is in the heart of downtown on Saint Catherine street, with its big sign it hard to miss and this place is know for its smoked meat sandwiches which what put them on map and I dont blame them for keeping to it.Thou I went a different route then smoke meat sandwich. As people have read in my reviews. Im a burger guy, while the burgers weren't on cheap side, they were a good. I had the Alamo burger. Which was two type of cheese,  onion strings and bbq sauce with a 1/2 pound patty it was a good size and filling for me.the patty was juicy, favourful, all and all a good meal,  got to have smoked meat if i got time before i leave
Good food, Montreal at it's best!!The portions are generous and fresh.Must go place if you are in Montreal

A lot more expensive than Schwartz but at least you get a dining experience and there are no line ups. I myself am not a smoked meat fan but my friends are. They love the poutine there $10 and the meat itself is apparently really good. I ended up with a classic club. Which by all standards was as good as any chicken club. However, the portion of the chicken was half that of the bread so it would have been nice to have a bigger piece. $15 But then again, I am at a restaurant that caters more to smoked meat than anything else. Staff is great! Good job. I have nothing against the place, just not my usually cup of tea.

We had dinner and breakfast.  I had just salad and onion soup for dinner, which are good, no complaints.  For breakfast, I had bagel with smoked salmon, and it was awesome, with good amount of salmon.

Woah woah woah! Ruben is my favorite sandwich... so I've probably had over 100 of them from various locations. Or so I thought. Until I put this foreign sandwich between my lips. That. That my friends. Is the taste of perfectly toasted rye bread holding together a stack of smoked meat of highest quality, drizzled with their special sauce and crunchy sauerkraut. There has never nor will there ever be a Ruben like this. Key points: reasonably priced, service was attentive and polite, gets fairly busy but food was quickly delivered. They have cheesecake slices the height of a small monkey.  This is a MUST have while visiting. Must have Rueben!

Great food but poor service. Waiter took forever to come take our order. Also, it was a bit later at night so everyone was focused on cleaning and closing up. Got a double bloody Cesar and it was the same price as my meal 17.99$. I dont remember the prices being this high for drinks and i have to admit i was a little shocked to see my bill. I won't be returning anytime soon.

Extremely slow and the old lady nearly ignored us. Waited for nearly half an hour before getting the food. I don't understand why so many people gave good ratings. Do not come here unless you literally wanna kill your time and waste a morning/afternoon of your life starving in this restaurant.
Great restaurant. We went from the smoked meat sandwiches and it was probably the best sandwich I've ever had. Great drink and an overall great atmosphere. Highly recommended if you're in Montreal
Decent but not worth the big price tag. The food feels industrialized and tasteless. You can eat double the food at the same price in other places.
